cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to continue northwest across the northwest Caribbean, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, then move north-northwest over the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla Honduras, the Bay Islands, Puerto Cabezas Nicaragua northward to the Honduras/Nicaragua border, and Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean coasts of Nicaragua and Honduras, eastern Yucatan, and the northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana eastward to Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 2-4 inches at most)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (track keeps strongest onshore winds east of Houston)
weather_observation.wind: 10-15% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) Monday night–Tuesday; brief gusts possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast if winds shift onshore, but >3 ft is not expected at this time
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 2–4 inches of rain; localized street flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Periods of lightning in outer convection bands; otherwise none significant
